block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

list.l: You guessed it! My number is

block-definition.comment: Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.

block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

block-definition.comment: Takes a text string as input, and reports a new text string containing all but the first character of the input.

Takes a text string as input, divides it into words treating one or more spaces as a word separator (only spaces count; punctuation is part of the word) and reports a text string containing all but the first word, with one space between words and no spaces at the beginning or end. (Note: consider using SENTENCE->LIST and processing the resulting list instead of doing recursion on sentences in text string form. List operations are faster.)
Takes a text string as input, and reports a new text string containing all but the last letter of the input.

Takes a text string as input, divides it into words treating one or more spaces as a word separator (only spaces count; punctuation is part of the word) and reports a text string containing all but the last word, with one space between words and no spaces at the beginning or end. (Note: consider using SENTENCE->LIST and processing the resulting list instead of doing recursion on sentences in text string form. List operations are faster.)

Takes a text string as input, divides it into words treating one or more spaces as a word separator (only spaces count; punctuation is part of the word) and reports a text string containing only the first word, with no spaces before or after it.
Takes a text string as input, and reports the last character in the string.

Takes a text string as input, divides it into words treating one or more spaces as a word separator (only spaces count; punctuation is part of the word) and reports a text string containing only the last word of the input, with no spaces before or after it.
Takes a text string as input, and reports TRUE if the string has no characters in it of any kind, otherwise false.
Takes a text string as input, and reports TRUE if the input contains no characters other than spaces (therefore, no words when the string is considered as a sentence), otherwise FALSE.

block.l: var index=string.indexOf(marker); if (index<0) {return string;} return string.slice(0,index);

block-definition.comment: Takes a text string as input, and reports a new text string containing all but the first character of the input.

Takes a text string as input, divides it into words treating one or more spaces as a word separator (only spaces count; punctuation is part of the word) and reports a text string containing all but the first word, with one space between words and no spaces at the beginning or end. (Note: consider using SENTENCE->LIST and processing the resulting list instead of doing recursion on sentences in text string form. List operations are faster.)
Takes a text string as input, and reports a new text string containing all but the last letter of the input.

Takes a text string as input, divides it into words treating one or more spaces as a word separator (only spaces count; punctuation is part of the word) and reports a text string containing all but the last word, with one space between words and no spaces at the beginning or end. (Note: consider using SENTENCE->LIST and processing the resulting list instead of doing recursion on sentences in text string form. List operations are faster.)

Takes a text string as input, divides it into words treating one or more spaces as a word separator (only spaces count; punctuation is part of the word) and reports a text string containing only the first word, with no spaces before or after it.
Takes a text string as input, and reports the last character in the string.

Takes a text string as input, divides it into words treating one or more spaces as a word separator (only spaces count; punctuation is part of the word) and reports a text string containing only the last word of the input, with no spaces before or after it.
Takes a text string as input, and reports TRUE if the string has no characters in it of any kind, otherwise false.
Takes a text string as input, and reports TRUE if the input contains no characters other than spaces (therefore, no words when the string is considered as a sentence), otherwise FALSE.

block.l: var index=string.indexOf(letter); if (index<0) {return string;} return string.slice(0,index);

var done = false function initialize (callback) { var head = document.head; // Sequentially load bigints then schemeNumber var bigScript = document.createElement('script'); bigScript.src = 'http://bjc.edc.org/bjc-r/prog/4-internet/biginteger.js'; bigScript.onload = loadScheme; head.appendChild(bigScript); function loadScheme() { var schemeScript = document.createElement('script'); schemeScript.src = 'http://bjc.edc.org/bjc-r/prog/4-internet/schemeNumber.js'; schemeScript.onload = finish; head.appendChild(schemeScript); } function finish () { makeGlobalObject() callback() } } function makeGlobalObject () { window.bigNumbers = { originalEvaluate: InputSlotMorph.prototype.evaluate, originalPrims: { reportSum: Process.prototype.reportSum, reportDifference: Process.prototype.reportDifference, reportProduct: Process.prototype.reportProduct, reportQuotient: Process.prototype.reportQuotient, reportModulus: Process.prototype.reportModulus, reportRandom: Process.prototype.reportRandom, reportLessThan: Process.prototype.reportLessThan, reportGreaterThan: Process.prototype.reportGreaterThan, reportEquals: Process.prototype.reportEquals, reportIsIdentical: Process.prototype.reportIsIdentical, reportMonadic: Process.prototype.reportMonadic } }; } function loadBlocks () { var fn = SchemeNumber.fn; var originalPrims = window.bigNumbers.originalPrims; if (useBigNums) { InputSlotMorph.prototype.evaluate = function () { var num, contents = this.contents(); if (this.constant) { return this.constant; } if (this.isNumeric) { return parseNumber(contents.text || '0'); } return contents.text; }; Object.assign(Process.prototype, { reportSum: function (a, b) { try { return fn['+'](a, b); } catch (err) { return NaN; } }, reportDifference: function (a, b) { try { return fn['-'](a, b); } catch (err) { return NaN; } }, reportProduct: function (a, b) { try { return fn['*'](a, b); } catch (err) { return NaN; } }, reportQuotient: function (a, b) { try { return fn['/'](a, b); } catch (err) { return NaN; } }, reportModulus: function (a, b) { try { var result = fn['mod'](a, b); if (fn['<'](b, 0) && fn['>'](result, 0)) { result = fn['+'](result, b); } return result; } catch (err) { return NaN; } }, reportRandom: function (min, max) { var floor = parseNumber(min), ceil = parseNumber(max); if (!fn['='](fn.mod(floor, 1), 0) || !fn['='](fn.mod(ceil, 1), 0)) { return fn['+']( fn['*']( Math.random(), fn['-'](ceil, floor) ), floor ); } return fn.floor( fn['+']( fn['*']( Math.random(), fn['+']( fn['-'](ceil, floor), 1 ) ), floor ) ); }, reportLessThan: function (a, b) { try { return fn['<'](a, b); } catch (err) { return a < b; } }, reportGreaterThan: function (a, b) { try { return fn['>'](a, b); } catch (err) { return a > b; } }, reportEqual: function (a, b) { try { return fn['='](a, b); } catch (err) { return snapEquals(a, b); } }, reportIsIdentical: function (a, b) { try { return fn['='](a, b); } catch (err) { return originalPrims.reportIsIdentical(a, b); } }, reportMonadic: function (fname, n) { n = parseNumber(n); if (n !== n) return NaN; switch (Process.prototype.inputOption(fname)) { case 'abs': return fn.abs(n); case 'ceiling': return fn.ceiling(n); case 'floor': return fn.floor(n); case 'sqrt': return fn.sqrt(n); case 'sin': return fn.sin(radians(n)); case 'cos': return fn.cos(radians(n)); case 'tan': return fn.tan(radians(n)); case 'asin': return degrees(fn.asin(n)); case 'acos': return degrees(fn.acos(n)); case 'atan': return degrees(fn.atan(n)); case 'ln': return fn.log(n); case 'log': return fn.log(n, 10); case 'e^': return fn.exp(n); case '10^': return fn.expt(10, n); default: return 0; } } }); } else { InputSlotMorph.prototype.evaluate = window.bigNumbers.originalEvaluate; Object.assign(Process.prototype, originalPrims); } done = true; } function parseNumber (num) { if (!(num instanceof SchemeNumber)) { try { return new SchemeNumber('' + num); } catch (err) { return NaN; } } return num; } function isDone () { return done; } if (window.bigNumbers) { loadBlocks(); } else { initialize(loadBlocks); } return isDone;

block-definition.comment: LABEL will stamp text on the stage at the given font size. The direction of the text is the direction the sprite is facing, and color will match the pen color.

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), context = stage.penTrails().getContext('2d'), rotation = radians(this.direction() - 90), trans = new Point( this.center().x - stage.left(), this.center().y - stage.top() ), isWarped = this.Warped, len, pos; if (isWarped) {endWarp(); } context.save(); context.font = size + 'px monospace'; context.textAlign = 'left'; context.textBaseline = 'alphabetic'; context.fillStyle = this.color.toString(); len = context.measureText(text).width; trans = trans.multiplyBy(1 / stage.scale); context.translate(trans.x, trans.y); context.rotate(rotation); context.fillText(text, 0, 0); context.translate(-trans.x, -trans.y); context.restore(); pos = new Point( len * Math.sin(radians(this.direction())), len * Math.cos(radians(this.direction()))); pos = pos.add(new Point(this.xPosition(), this.yPosition())); this.gotoXY(pos.x, pos.y, false); this.changed(); if (isWarped) {this.startWarp(); } stage.changed();

var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), hats = []; if (message !== '') { stage.lastMessage = message; process.getObjectsNamed(spriteName, this, stage).forEach(function (morph) { hats = hats.concat(morph.allHatBlocksFor(message)); }); hats.forEach(function (block) { stage.threads.startProcess(block, stage.isThreadSafe); }); }
var index=string.indexOf(marker); if (index<0) {return string;} return string.slice(0,index);
